dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE DOWN from a view of Paris on a misty day.   Cool, gray and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi stops by the curb of a wide, cobbled street. All around there is bustle and activity, with cars and people hurrying about their business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and a pair of exquisitely shaped female legs in Christian Louboutin high heels swing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW the legs up the steps, across the concourse, through the station. Men turn and stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARA MASON (30, stunning) shows no sign of noticing. She wears dark glasses and carries a traveling bag in one hand, a copy of the International Herald Tribune in the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WAITER wiping down the bar stops to watch Cara enter and take a seat at a table slightly set apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OLDER WAITER approaches her. They exchange a few words and he walks toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's waiting for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably waiting for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's waiting for you if you don't get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MESSENGER clad in leather, wearing a motorcycle helmet, enters the cafe and looks around. He consults a photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes land on Cara. He walks over and holds out a document-sized envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'est vous, Mademoiselle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the messenger walks away she opens the folder and shakes out the contents. There is a ticket for the Orient Express and a handwritten letter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spreads it out on the table like a precious treasure map. Her beautiful forehead creases with concentration as she reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (English accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are following you Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up. Takes out a small makeup mirror and holds it in front of her face to glance around behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They think you'll lead them to me. But if you follow my instructions closely, there is a way for us to get away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara scans the rest of the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA glides down to see the signature at the bottom: "Love, Alexander."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We barely have time to read this before Cara's perfectly manicured hand crumples the letter, places it in a saucer and sets fire to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG WAITER hurries over, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle!    Je vous en prie--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara is already gathering her things and walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Cara walks toward the platform...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the 4:25 Orient Express to Venice. En route select a man my approximate height and weight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes scan the platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have faith Cara. I'll be with you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men of various shapes and sizes are boarding "The Orient Express." She pauses only long enough to assess and discard: too old, too young, too thin, too overweight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her gaze comes to rest on a WELL-DRESSED FRENCH MAN. Medium height, medium build. Standing alone. Examining his ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara glances at her reflection critically in the polished glass window of the train. Adjusts her hair and dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Satisfied with what she sees, she turns and starts toward the WELL-DRESSED FRENCH MAN like a cat stalking prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA admiringly FOLLOWS her silky approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FRENCH MAN hears the click of her heels and looks up. His mouth falls open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS WIFE arrives and shuts it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing Vincent?   Our train car is over here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a regretful backward glance at Cara, he allows himself to be dragged away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Cara turns and casts about for another possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots a TOUSLE HAIRED MAN seated on a bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All aboard! All aboard the 4:25 is departing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tousle Hair gathers his bags to get on the train. Encouraged, Cara moves to cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tousle Hair stands up REVEAL... he's six foot seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stops short, irritated. The MAN behind her boarding the train is fumbling with his suitcase and doesn't notice. BAM he walks straight into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!   Excuse me. Pardone moi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK TAYLOR (30's, amiable) is a cheerful American tourist. Open face, completely lacking in guile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank continues to mutter apologies as he walks gingerly around Cara and boards the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara watches him with thinly veiled contempt. Frank is a man of average size, average build... she peers over her glasses at him. And her expression slowly changes. She follows him onto the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOOD-LOOKING ENGLISHMAN loitering further down the platform, reading the Herald Tribune. Or rather, not reading it. He's been watching Cara. He lowers the paper and climbs onto the train through a different door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gleaming Orient Express pulls out of the station and gets underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train is moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thick carpet, the mellow wood of the inlaid panels, the subtlety of the Lalique mirrors and the softly lit lamps all inspire a feeling of great luxury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks vaguely out of place, sitting by the window in his casual jeans and pullover sweater. He's wrapped up in a dog-eared paperback spy novel. So wrapped up that he barely notices Cara sit down opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses her legs.   He glances up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, nonchalantly, she takes her coat off.   Then the headscarf tied around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW her sensual movements in TIGHT CLOSE UP. The effect is as if she's performing a tantalizing strip tease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is captivated to the point of being unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off her glasses to reveal stunning eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to remove her mock-turtleneck sweater.   The zipper seems to give her trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without bothering to struggle she sits up in her seat and leans toward Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm going to need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is barely able to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My zipper... (off his blank look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finally moves into action.   He sets his book down and leans closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkwardly he reaches towards Cara's beautiful neck. He attempts to unwind the trapped thread of fabric. But the zipper resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid of hurting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides forward on her seat, to get even closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train car sways slightly and throws Frank off balance. He tugs sharply and the zipper suddenly gives-- with a tearing sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank freezes, looking down at the zipper still in his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's eyes flash fury for a brief moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should let you do this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give up so quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Frank continues with the zipper. The tearing sound continues as he lowers the zipper, inch by inch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First her neck, then her throat, then her cleavage are gradually uncovered. The zipper keeps going downward. No sign of anything underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is practically sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he uncovers fabric. He finishes unzipping the sweater and sits back into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara slides it off her shoulders, sensuous as ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And settles back into her seat, cat-like. He stares at her for several moments, at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white-jacketed STEWARD arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you and your wife take dinner here or in the dining car this evening, monsieur?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon me?   Oh, no.   We're not actually--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dining car would be lovely, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The steward nods and disappears.    Frank just stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orient Express plows through the Alps. PUSH IN ON a window where we see Frank and Cara sitting at a romantic, candlelit table eating dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linen tablecloths. Fine china. Frank is one of the only men in the dining car not in a dinner jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank takes out a bottle of pills from his pocket, then another and another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes one or two pills from each and swallows them methodically. She watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at all the pills spread out beside his plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just nervous.    I don't like travelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently mocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you decided to take a holiday on the Orient Express?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honeymoon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara is annoyed at this revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we ask the waiter to set another place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in Pennsylvania.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off her questioning look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you want to hear this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd like to tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks ago she left me. For the owner of a pizza parlor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods, matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No travel insurance. No refund on the tickets. So... here I am. On my honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really loved that pizza too. "Bala Pizza" if you're ever in Rosemont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't touch it.    I'm loyal to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter delivers their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Cointreau for Mademoiselle. And for Monsieur... a "Miller Light."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter rolls his eyes and leaves them.    Cara seems amused by Frank's obliviousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What takes you to Venice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods toward his well-thumbed paperback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read spy novels. (playful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a mysterious woman on a train. You tell me what my story is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... you'd be a diplomatic attachГ© or... let's see... a girl from East Germany whose father's been kidnapped by Soviet agents. They're blackmailing you into stealing... probably a microchip. There's usually a microchip involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What awaits me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble, certainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt. You'll probably be shot at in less than two chapters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a man in my life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a candidate for the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes at her with a glimmer of hope. She's insanely out of his league. But she's the one flirting with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The magnificent Prefecture de Police on the Ile de la CitГ©. A convoy of black Mercedes arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps echo in the grand marble hallways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN ACKERMAN moves down the hall with purpose. British, Interpol chief inspector. He's the kind of man who commands respect (think Tommy Lee Jones in The Fugitive.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELISSA JONES, his American counterpart matches him step for step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're putting a lot resources into this investigation, John. Tell me you're going to get him this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to get him this time, Ms. Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOYAL, (Ackerman's Deputy) closes his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the train. They'll be in Venice in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the ornate, 17th century doors is a high-tech amphitheater style briefing room. All glass and steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suited bureaucrats and officers from all over Europe listen to Ackerman as he leads the meeting from the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our target's name is Alexander Pearce. British citizen, born in London into an ordinary middle class family. The only thing remarkable about his childhood was a preternatural gift for numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman clicks a slide projected on a large screen behind him: a fuzzy photo of a British schoolboy with a shy grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which he used to hack into a computer and fix the test results his final year at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEAN LUC (French Interpol liaison) looks up skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mastermind couldn't pass his exams on his own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't fix his test scores; he fixed the scores for all the girls in the class. It made him very popular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ripple of laughter through the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (severely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What started as school pranks eventually became something much more serious. After a year in the training program at Goldman Sachs, he decided that gambling suited him better than working for a living. That, in turn, involved him with some rather unsavory people and ultimately led him to put his financial genius to work in his true calling: money laundering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUINN is the Swiss Interpol liaison. He speaks with the crisp accent of a man who is fluent in several languages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've assembled quite a task force to catch a common money launderer, Mr. Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing common about Alexander Pearce. Quiet simply, he has turned money laundering into an art form. His greatest innovation: The False Lawsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks through a series of flashy Powerpoint slides illustrating Pearce's financial dealings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearce sets up two companies: one is a Casino in Arizona for example and the other is a shell company in the Cayman Islands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cayman Islands company files a lawsuit against the casino, claiming copyright infringement or some other complaint. They "succeed" in winning the case and the casino pays the shell company an enormous settlement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money travels from America to the Cayman Islands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but now the money is legal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite legal. The I.R.S. has been cheated out of the revenue. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We calculate that Mr. Pearce's tax bill currently stands at $743.7 million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Luc leans toward his colleague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That explains what the American harridan is doing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Jones gives him a glacial stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactement, monsieur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Luc reddens. Oops.   Apparently not every American fits the stereotype.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Pearce has some other debts as well. Most of you will recognize Ivan Demidov...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click: A PHOTO of a balding RUSSIAN OLIGARCH emerging from a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Pearce laundered over a billion dollars for Demidov. At some point Pearce decided he'd rather steal from Demidov than help him steal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Given Demidov's ties to organized crime, I'd say that was a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clears her throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. Government is not participating in an investigation of a member of the Russian parliament; our target is Alexander Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman smiles coolly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INTERPOL OFFICER from Germany raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Mr. Pearce ever been in custody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman looks down for a moment, as if it pains him to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog covers the skyline, exposing only the slate rooftops of buildings that haven't changed in centuries. We hear the sound of water gently lapping the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the mist emerges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARDACOSTE -- a patrol boat, lights dimmed. It gently touches the beach. A CARABINIERI officer lowers a ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INTERPOL TACTICS TEAM in Kevlar and headgear pours out of the patrol boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman steps off, pulling on a vest.     He nods to Goy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.     Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They follow the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A SPECIALIST who kneels to open an electric panel. REVEAL a glass plate with a fingertip shape in the center. The SPECIALIST places his hand against the glass: a red light beeps on -- it's a bio-metric lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna take a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman betrays no impatience. He knows better than to rush the professionals. He simply nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Specialist opens a tool box filled with sophisticated gear and gets to work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrapping a towel around herself, CARA MASON, the girl from the train, stares at herself in the bathroom mirror for a beat. So do we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps out into the lofty master bedroom suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dressing room, Cara calls out to someone in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be ready in fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara sits on the bed, drying her hair. On a night table beside her are keys, a wallet and an expensive MAN'S WATCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara pauses; she's heard something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks across the tiled floor to the balcony overlooking the elevator entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes; six tactics OFFICERS face her with guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACKERMAN steps up the stairs, pistol in hand. He gestures at Cara to be quiet and come towards him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stands stock still for a long instant.   Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAMS the oaken door of the master bedroom suite in Ackerman's face, locking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She calls out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman shakes the doorknob, cursing; a Tall Commander calls for the BATTERING RAM which is rushed up the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tactics team CRACKS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman charges into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stands frozen beside the man's effects on the night table. The wallet. The keys. The watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the other side of the room, Ackerman sees an OPEN WINDOW, which the ocean breeze swings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rushing forward he sticks his head out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging outside the window is the rigging for a WINDOW WASHER'S PLATFORM - a platform that seconds before was lowered to the sand below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, a recently boarded water taxi pulls away from the dock and sails out into the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman turns to face the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the desk is a cup of coffee with steam gently rising from its surface. A cigarette sits lit in an ashtray, the smoke curling toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman stares at the empty, slowly revolving, chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks toward CARA, now in custody.      He holds her defiant gaze for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have nothing to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara looks at him for a moment, then lowers her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tall Commander shepherds the handcuffed Cara down the stairs and into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wears Alexander's WATCH....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does this Alexander Pearce look like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman closes the file in front of him on the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows. He disappeared after his escape. He's had extensive plastic surgery to alter his appearance since then. Drug lord Amado Carillo did the same thing in the 90s to successfully elude authorities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearce worked with no more than a few accomplices at one time. He treated them so well that they're virtually all completely loyal. None of them would cooperate. We've questioned the ones we could find, and the only thing we learned is that Pearce apparently arranged it so even his own people have never seen him after the surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So nobody knows what he looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me for saying so Mr. Ackerman, but he slipped away from you when you knew his whereabouts and his appearance...  What makes you think you can catch him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman regards him with aplomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His girlfriend was recently released from custody. He'll come for her. We'll be waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman clicks on a slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's face fills the screen behind him.   A murmur runs through the room. Every man stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll come for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman himself glances up at her face with a look of longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLD ON CARA'S IMAGE for a moment before we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARA stands alone on the platform amid the bustle of the station. The gleaming train stretches out behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's eyes drift open. He glances out the window and as his vision comes into focus he sees that the train is stopped. He sits bolt upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONDUCTOR'S VOICE over the loudspeaker is saying something in Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stumbles over himself to collect his things:      b sweater, pills, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank struggles down the aisle, bumping into fellow passengers and apologizing as he goes. All the while looking around for a sign of Cara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps off the train and glances about at the hive of activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank brushes past the GOOD-LOOKING ENGLISHMAN from the Paris station. Finally he spots her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK'S POV - Cara with her back turned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid I'd missed you. I wanted to ask where you're staying in Venice... I'm supposed to catch a shuttle to my hotel but I thought maybe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a better idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out her valise for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes it hesitantly. She peers at him over the rims of her sunglasses with a very slight smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beauty shot of the Grand Canal: magnificent palaces and churches soar upwards on either side in all their glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN ON A launch labelled Danieli, travelling fast over the water. Cara shakes her head to let the wind ruffle her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES PAST HER TO REVEAL Frank, clutching the railing beside her, afraid to wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leads us through the distinctive, revolving glass door into the low-ceilinged entrance lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCOVER Cara at the desk talking to the receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a booking in the name of Mason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, Signorina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signora. That's my husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods at Frank. For a second, the receptionist cannot keep the surprise out of his eyes. This glamorous, superbly dressed creature is married to a dull, American tourist in a T-shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He recovers his composure and alters his manner at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, Senora Mason. Welcome to the Danieli. You are in the Doge's-- our premiere suite. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything special you require?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a copy of today's Herald Tribune sent up to the room please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure, Signora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a large gold key and nods to a porter to take the luggage. Frank hurries to catch up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE RECEPTIONIST he watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God, what a waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together, they follow the porter into the ravishing, open central hall of the hotel, with the great, ornate staircase soaring up and up, past Gothic galleries and finely carved balustrades, beckoning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Cara trail the porter across the marble floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances about, dazed with delight and amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a gilded and coffered ceiling, portraits of the Doges flank a vast, hooded fireplace. The porter is showing them round the huge apartment, opening and closing doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bedroom is through here. You have two bathrooms, here and here. There is a small kitchen which...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at Cara; she doesn't look like a woman who spends a lot of time in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you may not need. There are two televisions, video, DVD, radio, hi fi sound system. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porter throws open a pair of French windows.   He let the view speak for itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step forward. The whole of St. Mark's Basin and the Venetian lagoon are laid out below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything satisfactory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will leave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porter looks expectantly to the "husband" for a tip. Frank doesn't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat. Cara takes a few Euros from her purse and tips him. The Porter exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands on the balcony in a daze. He stares down at the Molo and across St. Mark's Basin to San Georgio Maggiore. Cara joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens his mouth to answer.    Then laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's not to like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have been bored here on my own. There's more than enough room for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask for an extra bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at her for a beat, barely able to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right with the sofa? If you like, I can have them bring one up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face falls.   He tries to cover up his reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. The sofa's fine. Perfect in fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can say more, the buzzer sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back inside to answer the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara remains alone on the balcony, immobile, as if holding her breath. She's waiting... listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks across to the door. There is a small spyhole and he looks through it. The porter stands there with a trolley. Frank opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porter wheels the trolley in and starts to carry the bags into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara relaxes again as she hears Frank approach.   He step outside on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've put my things in the other bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been to Venice before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we need to go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS WITH GOYAL as he weaves through a sprawling mess of personnel and equipment, cell phones, computers and cables from various national agencies. The United Nations-aspect of the Task Force gives it impressive scope but also results in a Tower-of-Babel effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The calm eye of the storm is Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's checked into the Danieli... she's not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (to the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maintain surveillance but keep your distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to get clever: remember that Pearce is smarter than most of you put together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON QUINN who quietly slips out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gulfstream G550 executive jet banks over the Venetian coast and comes in for a landing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheels down. Stairway unfolds. The man who steps off the plane is dressed in a hand-tailored Italian suit and shoes that cost more than some cars. He's flanked by two bodyguards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IVAN DEMIDOV.   In the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA floats over the rooftops toward the penthouse of a ultra-high end business hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov sips a glass of red wine. The view from his room rivals the one at the Danieli but Demidov pays no attention. He's busy scanning his emails on his Blackberry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock, knock. A thick-necked BODYGUARD in the background goes to answer the door. A moment later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ushers in Quinn, the Swiss Interpol agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a seat, Mr. Quinn. Can I offer you a glass of Brunello? It's a '97...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thank you, Mr. Demidov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov swirls his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'd never admit this at home, but Vodka is for peasants. There's much we could learn from the Italians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles pleasantly at Quinn, then, on a dime, he turns back to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me I'm not going to be disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn takes out an envelope and passes it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flips it open and examines the contents.     WE GLIMPS photo of CARA and some text.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He always had good taste...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov makes a gesture and a second BODYGUARD with a SCAR on his face gives Quinn an envelope filled with cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn tucks it away discreetly, as if embarrassed by the directness of the pay off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Demidov... if I may ask you a question... Why do you care so much about Alexander Pearce? I mean, you've come here yourself... as if it were personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov looks at Quinn thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It may be difficult for you to understand, Mr. Quinn; you Swiss are mercenary by nature. But for some of us, there are things more important than money. I put my trust in Alexander Pearce. He betrayed that trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quinn smiles tightly.   He's ready to get out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's bad business to let somebody make a fool of you. If Pearce gets away with it, what does that say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clear, bright winter day at the beach. Devoid of tourists, the famous stretch is a completely different Venice from the one we're used to seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandbanks stretch out into the dark green sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara and Frank walk on a deserted patch of sand.   The wind wraps her light sun dress around her body, intermittently hugging her perfect curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... when you're not on a Grand European Tour, what do you do in Rosemont, Pennsylvania?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a teacher. High school math. And you? What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at him slyly over her movie star shades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I do, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound of voices and laughter drift toward them. Up ahead on the beach they see a group of Italians in formal clothes. A woman wears a white bridal dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look... a wedding.   How lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really into weddings at this particular moment in my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes.   I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes his arm and steers him toward a bistro with sidewalk tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara and Frank are seated.    A bottle of Orvieto rests o the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think it's really over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she'll change her mind. Women do. She might give you a second chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose that's a possibility. (hesitates)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I tell my statistics class anyway; life is a game of chance. Endless possibilities and permutations. You just have to calculate the odds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't answered the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to think that love is a question of destiny, not chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara looks at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment there you just reminded me of somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and takes a sip of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a way of dancing around a question so eloquently that you never noticed until later that he'd completely avoided the truth. His entire life was wrapped up in deception. (lost in thought)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told so many lies, I wouldn't believe him even if he finally did tell the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't sound like much of a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances at her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you wearing his watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're smarter than you look, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingertip over the face of the watch. Then, impulsively unclasps it and reaches for Frank's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're right. Here, take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts it on Frank's wrist, over his protests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No, I can't. This thing must be worth a fortune--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I insist. You're doing me a favor. (firm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it or I'll toss it in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hesitates.   She means it.    He closes the clasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll wear it until you regain your senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He feels the heft of it on his wrist. Admires it for a moment. It really is a beautiful watch. She settles back in her chair, pleased with herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and sees her smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suits you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT of Frank and Cara framed by the sunset. A romantic dinner for two. They could easily be lovers or honeymooners...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the foreground REVEAL somebody watching them.   The good-looking Englishman is there, hovering...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key sounds in the lock and the door swings open. Frank and Cara tumble in together, laughing, a little tipsy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances at the sofa and that sobers him up, reminding him where he's going to sleep. However...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches Cara drop her wrap over a chair and kicks off her shoes. She throws open the French doors to the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank bypasses the sofa-bed and follows her outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara looks out across the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank appears beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could get used to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A movement in the street down below catches her eye. She studies the Ponte del Vin intently, seeing something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara turns abruptly to Frank and presses her body against his. He's taken by surprise but willingly responds to her advance, wrapping his arms around her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exchange a long, passionate kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL the lens of a PALM-SIZED VIDEO CAMERA peering out from behind a vendor's cart in the street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, his face slightly obscured, kisses Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR the WHIRRING of the video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still kissing, Cara leads Frank back into the hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silhouettes of Cara and Frank disappear into the hotel room as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara closes the curtains.   She pulls away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her composure changes; the passion is gone.   The expression on her face is matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should leave Venice tomorrow. (softer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a city for lovers Frank; no place to recover from a failed engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and walks toward her bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares after her in stunned disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses at the door.   Her expression softens slightly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.   I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she disappears into her bedroom. The door closes behind her and we hear the click of the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank remains standing alone, immobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After several moments he sits on the sofa.    There are t folded blankets and a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From within Cara's bedroom we can hear her voice, muffled but still audible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that's exactly what I'm doing, but now I want him to go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the door, straining to hear more but her words fade out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank gets ready for bed. He takes off the watch Cara gave him and something on the back of it catches his eye. It's engraved with a name:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the name for a moment, then unzips his travel bag. Takes out his pills. Pops a bunch. Brushes his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses and stares at himself in the mirror as if wondering how in the world he ended up here. It's like he's staring into the face of stranger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his tooth brush down and pads off to sleep on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the SHOWER reaches Frank in his sleep.     H blinks his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning is misty.   He closes the balcony doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's bedroom door is ajar. Frank struggles not to notice. He turns to his bed and begins folding sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he hears the sound of water running in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over at the door ajar, the sound of the shower... it's too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks to the bedroom door.   He pushes it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Cara's bathroom is open.   The outline of her naked body is visible in the shower.   She lifts her wet hair and soaps the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees him.   Cara is so stunned she simply stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks to the shower and opens the glass door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking in, he LIFTS Cara against the glass, clutching at her slithery body, kissing her frantically...she kisses him back with ardor, wrapping her dripping legs around his back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is sleeping. A smile on his face.          A shadow over him as somebody walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man's trouser leg is visible in the foreground, moving slowly toward Frank. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLANG!   Frank wakes with a start to see......

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER is setting up breakfast on a cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardone Signore. Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares in surprise at the food spread out before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La Signora ordered this for you when she left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When she...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around the suite.     He is alone. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter has finished.     He hovers for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Frank takes the hint and gives the man a one Euro tip. He takes it with disdain and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank throws off his blanket and sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank strolls into the room, barefoot, in his boxers. The bed is unmade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara has left a shirt over a chair... he picks it up and holds it to his face for a moment to enjoy her lingering scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a newspaper... a copy of The International Herald Tribune is open on her bedside table. He lifts it to see what Cara had been reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a personal ad that has been lightly dotted with a ball point pen. The message is just a list of words:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dots single out letters in a code... Frank picks up t pen and puts a faint line through the groups of unselected letters to reveal the message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tomorrow 11 Caffe Pesaro"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank studies this for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laying the paper on the table, Frank walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank reaches for the doorknob... then pauses.   Breakfas again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quietly slides the chain on.    Peers through the spyhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPYHOLE POV -- Two tough-looking men in suits stand there: most definitely not hotel staff. One has a scar on his face... Demidov's BODYGUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarface takes out a silenced PISTOL and mutters something in Russian to his partner. He produces a LOCK PICK SET and crouches out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hears the sound of scratching metal and clicking tumblers inside the lock. He looks around wildly. Sees the KEY on the entryway table and reaches for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ch-chunk. The Russian picks the lock and slowly starts to open the door. The chain stops it. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment later a KNIFE comes through the crack and starts to slide the chain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at the knife; he has to act fast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank throws his shoulder against the door. The knife clatters to the floor as the door slams shut. Frank jams his KEY into the lock and turns the bolt into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's angry confusion on the other side of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grabs a heavy glass ashtray and swings it at the back of the key-- breaking it off in the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank scrambles out of the way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of metal scraping in the lock. Russian CURSING can be heard just outside. A heavy blow as they try to shoulder the door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks around desperately for an escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bathroom?   The sitting room?   Adjoining doors?   No

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nowhere to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank bolts for the balcony in his bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scrambles outside as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POP! POP! POP! Bullets rip through the wood and metal, blasting the lock assembly apart. The door bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks down and stares at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the cobblestones of the Ponte del Vin below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests sit on their balconies with their morning coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three balconies over, Frank sees the rooftop of the modern wing of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two TOUGHS rapidly move through the room, searching. Nyet, Nyet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one place they haven't checked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank puts one bare foot on the stonework. He grimaces as he HEAVES himself onto the railing of the balcony adjacent to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs desperately, flailing, 100 feet over the street below. He gets a tentative hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PALLID FRENCH WOMAN drops her coffee and screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians sprint out to the balcony.    They spot Frank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who shoves the Pallid Woman inside, struggles past her breakfast table, and prepares to leap again-- but slips on the spilled coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets shatter China around him. He cuts his foot on a broken plate. He grabs his bleeding foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it!   I'm a fucking tourist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another round of shots ring out.    They don't seem to care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes over the railing with another awkward HEAVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His pursuers scale the adjoining stone work and step onto the Pallid Woman's balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time Frank lands in the lap of a BURLY WELSHMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are ya bloody mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Burly Welshman PUNCHES Frank in the stomach, which drops him out of the way of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which explode into the Welshman's shoulder.   He cries ou and falls down on top of Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians stand on the Pallid Woman's balcony and prepare to JUMP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Frank crawls out from under the wounded Welshman and peers over the next balcony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is at least TWENTY FEET from the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He misjudged the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs through the hotel room, past the Welshman's wife to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SHOT behind him and pounding feet send him out into the corridor past a room service steward to an...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which   will not do but the--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STAIRS will and Frank flies down the steps, three at a time, hearing his pursuers above him, running harder than he's run in his entire life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's slow and they gain on him enough to aim weapons through the railing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-CHING, several bullets ricochet like pinballs in the metal stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pants as he pushes out a side door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sprints along the edge of the canal, dodging tourists and children, vendors and locals. He spots a VENDOR'S three wheel BICYCLE and jumps on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he pedals, he realizes it's too slow so he JUMPS OFF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and FALLS - a painful spill, he cuts his hand - but clambers to his feet as the Russians bear down. Running up hidden stairs he finds the roof of a shop on the Riva Degli Schiavoni...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs down the ridge of the roof.   A silenced shot hits roof tile nearby and throws him off balance. He FALLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...bumping down the other side of the roof until, as he topples over the edge, he thrusts a hand at the gutter, smashing his head against the wall. He drops onto the pavement along the edge of the small canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doubles back towards the lagoon. Looking back, he sees the men still in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns into the Campo San Zaccaria, scattering the flapping and fluttering PIGEONS.   The Gondolieri and their passengers watch the half-naked man run past and cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run faster, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians force their way past the pedestrians.    The have almost caught him when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ducking inside a leather shop, Frank heads straight for the back entrance and finds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands on the cobblestones. Blood streams from his forehead as well as his hand. He has

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to decide which way to go. The alley is long and narrow on either side. An awning above. Clear sight lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the shop upends the Grand Canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Russians burst out the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no sign of Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarface looks at the Canal. He walks to the edge of the water and SPRAYS gun fire atop it. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lies huddled on his back IN THE AWNING behind the leather shop, barely able to control his frantic breathing. He's mere feet away from the men who are trying to kill him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and sees: the scowling face of an Italian WOMAN peering out over her window box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank raises a desperate finger to his lips.    A prayer that she won't give him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him disapprovingly.     Then disappears back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON FRANK as he waits, his heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds tick past...   is he safe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rrrrrip! A black cylinder, like the barrel of a gun, tears through the awning fabric inches from his Frank's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cries out. The awning rips and dumps him down hard onto the cobblestones below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens his eyes and sees two pairs of black boots that belong to... A PAIR OF CARBINIERI who stand over him One of them holds a nightstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare down at the bloodied tourist in his underpants lying at their feet. They've seen stranger things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits alone with a blanket over his shoulders. Most of the blood has been wiped from his wound and he has a rough bandage on his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From down the hallway a cheery stubble-faced POLICE OFFICER, DOMENICO (30's, animated), walks into the room where Frank is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico laughs, talking on his cell phone as he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't let them stay over, man. You start cuddling and then she wants to borrow your car. Stop cuddling, Tomaso!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly noticing him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers told me to wait here. I've been sitting here for over two hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominico glances over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they forgot about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits back down heavily.    Domenico sits on the edg of a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico picks up Frank's statement and glances at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Taylor, wow, you had quite a day. Eh? We got chasing, we got shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico looks at mild-mannered Frank sitting there in his boxers. The story seems unlikely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm crazy but it's all true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you crazy AND it's true, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico looks at Frank a little harder.     Decides this guy is not making all this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so who are these guys? Why they mad at you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have absolutely no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They followed you from the Danieli?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came to the room. They pretended to be room service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't scopata one of their girlfriends or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't "scopata" anybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He consults a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara Mason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is quiet.   Domenico playfully points at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I catch you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In America the cops catch the crooks, not the victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha, we do that sometimes here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico considers for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is no domestic, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long you know Cara Mason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met her yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you take her to the Danieli? That must have been good meeting, yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't take her. She took me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The infectious grin again lights up Domenico's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lead an exciting life, Mr. Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not usually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico picks up the phone and dials a number. He talks in brisk Italian, listens again and replaces the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signora Mason was staying with "her husband" last night. You marry her, Mr. Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe Signora Mason might know why these guys behave badly. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a phone number, mobile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't give me one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico looks him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need some clothes.     I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves Frank alone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands and half-heartedly follows him to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spots something in the adjoining room; a computer that has been left on. He wanders over and looks at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An idea comes into Frank's head... he looks around. Nobod is watching him. He glances at the inscription on the WATCH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then quickly sits down. He does a search for "WANTED INTERNATIONAL CRIMINALS" and types in the name:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An immediate hit in the data base. Alexander Pearce's page fills the screen. The caption reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: #6 on INTERPOL'S MOST WANTED LIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In place of a photograph there is just a black outline of a man's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is about to scan for more information when he hears Domenico returning. He quickly steps back into the room where he was left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOMENICO enters carrying a garish SWEAT SUIT.   He hands it to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.     Put these on. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at the clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... thanks.   Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking you to the hospital, Mr. Taylor. A doctor should take a look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really rather just go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I put you in Padua, away from Venice. You'll be safe. (scribbles his number)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any worry, you call me. I give you my home number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lies flat on his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE leans over him with a kindly expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax signore. We're just going to make sure everything is all right inside your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides him slowly into the mouth of an MRI scanning machine head first. It hums to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico whistles as a hotel clerk escorts him to to the Doge's suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately we've already re-let the room. (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd rather the guests didn't know about the incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.   I'll be discreet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grazie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Clerk knocks.   The door is opened by Ivan Demidov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon, Signore, but this is a police officer. He needs to briefly examine the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov steps back, holding the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov watches Domenico, who sniffs around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm trying to find out, Signore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico gets down on his hands and knees and looks around. He spots something under the sofa and fishes it out with his penknife... a spent bullet casing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts it in a plastic bag, pleased with himself. Demidov catches his eye. He smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a good detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domenico stands and takes his leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry for the inconvenience. Enjoy your stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he and the clerk exit, Scarface steps out from the other room. Off Demidov's look, he leaves the suite to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lies on the bed. There are clean bandages on his injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television drones on the wall: an Italian reality show. A WOMAN holds her hands over her eyes. The HOST taunts her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now remember, I said you were in for a surprise... a big surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank waits for the surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman is tilted back with his eyes closed like he has a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones enters with a file labelled:    "Frank Taylor".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we find on the American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a tourist. Member of the teacher's union. Pays his taxes. Has bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidently. He had a pair of Russian hit men after him. Are you still going to tell me Demidov is clean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said he is clean.    I just said he isn't our target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just wondering how they tracked them down at the hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so long as they don't beat us to Pearce when the real one arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up at Goyal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the teacher now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The local police picked him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he's safely out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits up in his bed, reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT: Domenico - in his terrace flat. He wears a T- shirt and holds a glass of wine. Loud Italian pop music plays in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's official Mr. Taylor. You're not mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to the hotel. Somebody shot at somebody. I found a shell casing. I'll have it analyzed in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank glances around uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to be on a flight home tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, you're perfectly safe where you are. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have any visits from your Signora Mason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never let them cuddle, Mr. Taylor. One cuddle and it all turns to merda. Good night. If you need anything, you have my number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hangs up, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the restful silence he hears a DISTANT BANG. A gunshot? A door slam? Nervous, he gets up and goes to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks right and left. The corridor is empty and silent, lit by strip lights set on low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he's about to close the door again, Frank notices that there is a label stuck there with his name on it, just above the room number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles with the label for a few seconds, tearing it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sticks the label on the door to an empty room opposite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank goes to the sink and splashes water on his face. Stares at himself for several moments, as he did in the bathroom at the Danieli. He's lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the clang of a metal pushcart being wheeled along. Some footsteps approach. There are voices speaking an unfamiliar language, maybe Russian...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Russian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank scrambles for his clothes. He fishes out Domenico's phone number from a pocket and races to the phone. Then freezes, listening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The footsteps move away slightly... there is the sound of door opening. The door across the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds pass. The door is closed again.      The footstep move down the hall, slowly fading away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank punches in the policeman's number and grips the receiver. It rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A saucepot simmers on the stove. The phone RINGS. Behind it is a WINDOW - pierced by one circular bullet hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music still plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our gaze drifts downwards we see Domenico's bare feet, prone behind the kitchen island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS and RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is struggling into his clothes. Everything seems to stick and take forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the door a crack and looks down the ward. Nothing. He moves along the passage, slipping into doorways and out of the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the elevator and jabs at the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light shows it is approaching the floor. It stops. The doors open. Frank is about to enter it, when suddenly SOMEBODY STEPS OUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ORDERLY exits and brushes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank breaths a sigh of relief and steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank presses the button for Receptione et Terre and waits an interminable four seconds for the doors to close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly the elevator descends... and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open. A big MAN stands with his back to us, blocking the exit. Frank shrinks away, with nowhere to hide. The man turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a MALE NURSE, waiting to get into the lift. He stands aside to allow Frank to leave. Frank takes a step out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sees SCARFACE talking to the receptionist. Hurriedly, Frank reverses back into the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Nurse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, just before the doors close, Scarface turns... his eyes meet Frank's. He starts towards the elevator... but the doors shut first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lift stops again. The doors open on the first tier of the subterranean car park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leaps off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limping and terrified, Frank jogs towards the ramp marked Uscita in the far corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ENGINE ROAR splits the silence. The lights blind Frank in the darkness as the car careers towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He falls to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open. He squints. Sitting behind the wheel, calm and beautiful as ever, is CARA. He stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?    Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He climbs into the car.    She turns to him as she pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you miss me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances anxiously over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... you may not believe this but there are some people trying to kill me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara drives toward the ramp.     He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because I kissed you.
