dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops the car and waits for the metal gate at the top of the ramp to open. It rises with a loud creaking to REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLACK CAR with two men inside. One of them steps out and ducks under the gate as it rises up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While he's briefly silhouetted by the car's headlights we glimpse the outline of an AUTOMATIC WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With remarkable sangfroid she cuts the engine and lets her car roll backwards, gliding silently and perfectly into a parking spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the BLACK CAR slowly descend the ramp.   The Russian with the gun in his hand walks carefully alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank watches, holding his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of another engine cuts through the silence. pair of headlights come up from the level below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE CAR. The MALE NURSE from the elevator is driving up toward the exit ramp, toward the exit where the Russians are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE GUNMAN slipping back into the shadows and readying his gun to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK sees what is about to happen.    His face betrays h concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK. Cara presses the central door lock.      Frank's d doesn't budge. He looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the Nurse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy has nothing to do with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks her straight in the eye.    She relents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   If you want to play hero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns over the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara revs the car and pulls out fast, cutting off the Nurse's car. He leans on the horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the exit ramp, the metal parking gate is slowly being lowered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She weaves around the black car, deliberately heading for the gunman. He opens fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRRRRRAAAP!! Bullets spray wildly, ricocheting off the walls, shattering windshields... Frank covers his face as side-window pops, showering him with glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GUNMAN is forced to jump out of the way as Cara scrapes the side of her car along the wall. Sparks fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black car burns rubber as it U-turns to follow her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She guns it up the ramp towards the closing door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not enough room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's enough room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fence whirs at head height and keeps lowering.    The black car is closing in behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't make it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought Americans were optimists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last second he ducks instinctively and closes his eyes. The gate clips the top of Cara's car with a tremendous CLANG! Traps it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara presses her foot all the way down on the accelerator. Smoke pours from the tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black car RAMS them from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Russian leans out the window and fires at the outlines of Cara and Frank's HEADS. Bullets shatter the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara pushes Frank's head down. The sound of burning gears as the engine hits its limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, scraping paint, Cara's car SPRINGS forward, jetting out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fence drops further and shudders to a halt. The black car is trapped. The Russians can only watch as Cara speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quiet hum of the autostrade is the only sound in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits in a daze.   He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look that much like Alexander Pearce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara turns sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank holds up his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates.   A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You're about his size. That's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what your own boyfriend looks like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander crossed a very dangerous man. He changed his appearance in order to vanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I'm taking you somewhere you'll be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should go to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they did such a good job protecting you before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at her. Then relents, leaning his head back against the support and closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is parked along a muddy canal. Beside it runs a small disconnected set of palazzos. Cara shakes Frank. He won't wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank... Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's snoring.   She pinches his nose closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He startles awake.   She smiles mischievously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her past abandoned tricycles and very old men sitting on stone steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought I wouldn't get to do any sight-seeing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank steps over a greenish puddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses before a run-down palazzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The narrow hall is dark and shabby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara walks up the stairs to a door on the landing.     Sh opens it with a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is completely dark inside. The two of them maneuver in the darkness. The sound of a hand bumping against a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally somebody finds the light switch and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARA holds a .38 Taurus PISTOL in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank happens to be right in her line of sight.   He flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly directs the gun away from him.    Frank leans over, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara starts to giggle.   Frank starts to laugh too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apartment appears as if it was leased, stocked and then never set foot in again. Brand new appliances that have never been used.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank walks over to a flat screen TV and curiously peels off the protective clear film... He looks up and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara has her head inside the OVEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out, a flashlight in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making sure no one sabotaged the gas lines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank watches her walk over to the FUSE BOXES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pokes through the cupboards. Stocked with fine olives, tins of expensive smoked fish, viands, stewed fruit from orchards in France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the icebox. Inside is frozen meat and fish. pulls out one package of frozen orange steaks - it is labelled "BARRACUDA, CAUGHT ANTIGUA, 8/07".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes Barracuda fishing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara has poured herself a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes Marlin fishing. You catch the Barracudas by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at the steak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE FISH -- now seasoned, grilled and surrounded by whipped sweet potatoes, beets and almonds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank places a plate before Cara who sits with her wine at Pearce's oak table. She looks appreciatively at her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she left you for a cook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank smiles and pours himself a glass of wine.   Cara takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm!   That's decadent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With these ingredients, it's not hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank savors a bite of his meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know something? Food tastes better after you've been shot at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara laughs.   She clinks his glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I decided to come back for you, Frank Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch one another eat for several moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sets down her fork.   Leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like? Being a criminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scoffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You carry a gun, you consort with people being chased by killers... I hate to break it to you, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm a criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a big gulp of wine.     Moves over to the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for things to turn out like this. I always lived by a certain code. But then... I broke it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lapses into silence.    Frank comes and sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Alexander Pearce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.   Which is an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the most interesting man I've ever known. When I first met him, I wasn't expecting that. He took me by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts deeper into the leather cushions as if reliving a memory of sensual pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'd been prepared, I might not have loved him. But I wasn't. So I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She frowns into her empty wine glass.    Frank slides a little closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't regret it, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Regret what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kissing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks into her eyes. They are sitting very close on the sofa. The lights are low. The mood is romantic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank puts an arm over her shoulders and leans in for a kiss--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stands abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks   up at her, questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought what? That I saw you on the train and my heart stopped? That all my life I've been waiting for a math teacher from the Midwest to sweep me off my feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I picked you because of your height. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. His humiliation complete, he rises with as much dignity as he can muster and carries the plates into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara looks after him... exasperated yet already sorry for being so blunt. She is about to say something when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her CELL PHONE RINGS.     A special ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She answers right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ENGLISHMAN strolls the Piazza San Marco.    FOLLOW HI from behind as he speaks into his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been reading the newspaper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara narrows her focus. She walks away from Frank, stealing away into the bedroom. Her heart is beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... there was nothing there today. Is... is it you? Alexa--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No names.    Not on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAVE PATTERNS of the man's voice shimmer on a computer monitor. Goyal and Ackerman stand watching, hanging on every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the speakers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a busier weekend than I expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Place him.   Place him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HORN-RIMMED AIDE zeroes in on a MAP screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen gives him a map of VENICE.      Then zooms int map of the SAN MARCO district...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara holds one finger in her ear, listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a recipe in a Tuscan cookbook there I need. Would you look it up for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we really need another "recipe?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make sure our guests are surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Englishman passes the Lagoon to his left, and enters an enormous courtyard, the Arco Foscari. He looks down at his watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a brave and loyal girl. I'm in awe of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer map hones in on the PIAZZA SAN MARCO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!   Go!   Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal is already out the door and Ackerman grabs his Kevlar vest and follows, racing down the steps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara folds her arms as she listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you leave everything up to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pouts, only partially joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine by the way, in case you were concerned about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My only concern is for those who cross you, my love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last The Englishman arrives before the lower colonnade of the DOGE'S PALACE, the seat of medieval Venetian civic government. It is a wonder of Gothic architecture with spires piercing the blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes up at it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may not believe it, but every step of this miserable game is taken in the hope of earning your trust and ever-lasting regard. I mean that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Englishman is at the Ponte del Suspiri-- the "Bridge of Sighs."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's expression softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a talent for saying the right thing. (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank listens to the end of Cara's conversation, his forehead creased with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Englishman closes his phone and disappears into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara speaks urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent caravan of three black SUV's - a strange sight in Venice - pull up in perimeter around the Bridge of Sighs and skids to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman and the others leap out, looking around.   Then Ackerman sees it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Englishman's CELL PHONE, sitting on the cobblestones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach.   Goyal kneels to pick it up with a plasti bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should check for prints.    Maybe he forgot to wipe it down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding her now unimportant phone in her hand, Cara draws herself up and walks into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank lies asleep on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara walks to the kitchen and retrieves the Tuscan Cookbook. Thinking herself unobserved, she opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAGE has been turned down.   A recipe for LAMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara pulls out her red, felt-tipped pen. She finds a sentence in the recipe with a single pen dot beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapping her pen under letters on the page, Cara works out the code, memorizes the contents of the message and closes the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes are open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shots of the city as it comes to life in the winter time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boats are pushed out into the canals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trash is hosed from the cobblestone streets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tables and chairs are set out at sidewalk cafes, waiting for the tourists to come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an unfamiliar gentleness, Cara approaches Frank sleeping on the sofa and touches his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank... I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens his eyes and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out. All you need is here. In four or five days everything will be resolved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resolved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will all be over. I'll give you the all clear and you can go back to your life. This will be a great adventure you can look back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will I see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him evenly; one last glance between two people from two completely different worlds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has started down the stairs when Frank appears on the landing. He leans over the balustrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has stopped mid-flight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to risk everything for him. Would he do the same for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is quite straightforward in her response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. I love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't deserve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this is your business anymore. Now get back inside Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as she raises her voice a door opens below them in the hall, and an old man comes out. He looks up at Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signorina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is exactly what she did not want. But she controls her annoyance, nods in greeting and continues towards the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the neighbor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mi dispiace, Signor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Neighbor nods as Cara walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He admires Cara's shapely form as she crosses the cobblestone streets and disappears into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances back up at Frank and whistles appreciatively. Frank turns and goes back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman sits in an office chair, gently revolving. Jones, Goyal and Jean Luc are there as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do women find these con men so appealing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones is the only woman nearby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. I married my personal trainer. (sotto Jean Luc)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's twenty-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Luc can't tell if she's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did Pearce seduce that beautiful woman? Was it his charm? His looks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman sips from his ten thousandth cup of espresso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's because if he adores himself and spends every moment gratifying his desires, so then can she.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around to see if the others like this theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can become a child again. Who wouldn't want that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bitterness in Ackerman's tone that reveals he is personally hurt by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal's Blackberry makes a beep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's on the move. Time to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman pushes himself wearily to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By all means.    Let's follow the children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paging through the cookbook, Frank locates the page. He smiles in recognition at the familiar CODE pattern of red dots. He pulls out a PEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank examines a sleek, tiny electric razor that resembles a lollipop. Turning it on, he applies it. Pleased, he keeps shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting out of the shower, Frank enjoys the soft Frette towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the closets are dozens of flawless, custom-tailored suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flipping through the rack like a discerning shopper, Frank arrives at a suit that catches his fancy. Elegant and simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank struggles to close Alexander Pearce's pants around his lightly padded mid-section... a little too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is irritated to discover he's not quite as trim as Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank engages himself in a spontaneous program of CALISTHENICS. He struggles through a batch of push-ups, then sit ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank flosses his teeth. Then he backs up, taking in his outfit. The lines of the suit highlight his frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov is getting dressed. It's an elaborate ritual: carefully pressed pants, ironed shirt, starched collar, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His two BODYGUARDS stand nervously at attention, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a young man, times were very hard. When an opportunity presented itself, you took it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pats talcum powder on himself.    The men remain stone faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was twelve years old when Gregor asked me if I was ready for a man's job. He was the top chelovek in our housing block. So I said yes. He gave me a crowbar and told me to go bash in the skull of another boy who had stolen something from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points at his platinum cufflinks on a bedside table and snaps his fingers. Scarface hands them to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it just so happened this boy was a friend of mine. I did not want to do this terrible thing. But when you come from the streets, you have no choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carefully knots his tie in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked   very hard for years to get past   that life. So I would not have   to do these terrible things.    So I would have a choice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and smiles at his THICK-NECKED bodyguard.    He gestures toward the man's holstered pistol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have people like you to do these things for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand; THICK NECK hands him the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except that you don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Demidov pistol whips the man across the face!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood explodes from THICK NECK's nose.     He falls down one knee, clutching his face in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scarface looks on in fear. Demidov calms himself almost as quickly as he lost his temper. He drops the gun on the carpet and steps back in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did your job properly, I wouldn't have to get my hands dirty, you piece of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and walks into the bathroom to wash his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heels clicking on the cobblestones, Cara strides quickly along the Palazzo Vendramin en route to the Cipriani. She checks her watch. Then walks faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She passes a smallish transporto via cargo (supply boat) floating in the lagoon beside the Palazzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara approaches the poolside hotel restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a second story SUITE of rooms, The ENGLISHMAN peers through the curtains. He sees Cara seat herself at a TABLE between the pool and the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes settle on the transporto. Workers step on and off, carrying fresh linens into the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a small cabin on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cabin, Ackerman, Goyal, a videographer, a signals surveillance officer and a coordinating tactics officer huddle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman stares out the tinted window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACKERMAN'S POV - he can just see Cara sitting at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fanning herself with a newspaper, Cara discreetly evaluates the men in her sight lines. Venetian civic leaders chatting by the bar, tourists reading maps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her sunglasses she catches sight of a pair of YOUNG LOVERS drunk in each other's grasp in the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squinting, Ackerman evaluates his placements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A WAITER, idling at his bussing station, his eyes roaming the palazzo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A VAPORETTO CAPTAIN, who quietly turns away requests for a ride into St. Marks Square, his finger to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - An OLDER COUPLE sitting a few seats away from Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And an AGENTE DI POLIZIA (police patrolman) loud and jovial, joking with passersby, while quietly checking his earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speaks into the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the speakers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eh, we do not know any further...characteristics?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing a button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what we know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIDEO CAMERA swivels to follow a MAN, elegantly dressed, with trim hair who swiftly approaches Cara's table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing up, Ackerman holds his hand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the speaker)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold...wait for my signal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara glances up from her menu as she senses the elegant man approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER walks quickly toward Cara's table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elegant man is FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman stares at the monitor with Frank's face on it. He's quietly furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that fool doing in the middle of my operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stares slack-jawed at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has given himself a complete make-over.    New haircut Pearce's suit fits him well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks terrific. Cara notices before quickly recovering her composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for Alexander and me to meet face to face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about. Please go, I'd like to have a quiet coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at the table with Cara and eats a CASHEW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman barks whispered orders into the speaker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move off. Move off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UNDERCOVER WAITER quickly moves away from Cara's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman stares at the monitor which captures Cara's angry expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get rid of him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defiantly, Frank pulls his chair in closer to Cara.    He signals to a different THIN WAITER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caffe, per favore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns back to Cara, who calls out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cameriere!   No caffe for signor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (contradicting her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With milk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to be dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly, but I'm tired of being afraid. I've been running around like a frightened mouse long enough and I've decided I'm finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank pulls out a Gitane cigarette.   He lights it, smoking while he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I first saw the name I got scared: "Alexander Pearce." He even sounds like some super cool master criminal with Russian enemies and the beautiful girlfriend... he probably works out. He might own a pizza shop on the side for all I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank frowns at the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal is seated at the communication station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR - Frank is settled in opposite Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman peers directly out the window, as if he's going to see something different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put Lipetti in. Tell him to play it like he's dealing with a rowdy guest-- escort him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara looks all around.   No sign of any suitor approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: the hands of the THIN WAITER, who sprinkles pepper carefully, presumably onto a dish. He then platters the dish and lifts it over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, you have no idea what you're sticking your nose into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably not. But I'm doing it anyway. Alexander Pearce nearly got me killed. It was his idea, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told you to pick out some random sap on the train to take a bullet for him, didn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank works himself up, drawing courage from his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm not playing the role anymore. I'm going to confront him. He's supposed to meet you here, isn't he? I'm going to tell him exactly what I think of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. Another macho idiot. (to the waiter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conto, per favore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the lure, Cara? Obviously not his character. Is it the money? The luxury? What's any of that worth if you're getting shot at and you could go to jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's smooth, right? He probably has mistresses in every European city, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really a shame you've scared him off--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses some Euros on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of you make a nice couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THIN WAITER arrives with a PLATTER.   He sets it down in front of Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UNDERCOVER WAITER now moves toward the table with a grim expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THIN WAITER removes the platter.   Cara looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spelled out in SALT and PEPPER on the plate is the following:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara no sooner reads it than the Thin Waiter, who we now see is THE ENGLISHMAN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...BLOWS on the platter, scattering the salt and pepper granules to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Frank looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Englishman has already turned away, but the Undercover Waiter is moving quickly toward Cara's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undercover Waiter picks up speed, changing course slightly. WE SEE he's after The Englishman who is about to enter the restaurant kitchen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then FRANK steps in front of The Undercover Waiter, mistaking him for Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman slaps the cabin table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abort!   Abort, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undercover Waiter tries to move past Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hide out poolside and send your girlfriend and a total stranger to face the murderers who are after you? Not much of a tough guy, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank SHOVES him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I come from, we don't treat women like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grabs the Undercover Waiter's collar with unaccustomed strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara quietly picks up her bag and leaves the restaurant. She walks as fast as she can without being noticed toward the Palazzo Vendramin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the midst of his scuffle, Frank looks around and realizes she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Undercover Waiter's earpiece falls out in the melee.. Frank sees it and hesitates. Maybe this guy isn't Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting up from his seat in the cabin, Ackerman gestures for the captain of the transporto to leave the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR: Frank looks around and sees Cara:     fif feet away. Walking with purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That goddamn fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman rubs his face and squats down, frustrated beyond measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw him in the lagoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank brushes past tables, hits the street and RUNS down the Palazzo, toward Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara says nothing. She just shoots Frank an angry glance and climbs onto A VAPORETTO (water taxi).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs to the edge of the water as it motors away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he feels the presence of somebody behind him. TWO of ACKERMAN'S MEN are right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pin his arms forcefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok Signor... you can come with us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks at the two big men on either side of him. Then at Cara disappearing over the water. The fight drains out of him and he doesn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits alone in the sparsely furnished, windowless room. A table, two chairs. A large mirror on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank straightens his slightly disheveled suit, as if he's been dumped here without ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances in the mirror periodically, suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and Ackerman enters. He pulls up one of the chairs and gestures for Frank to do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks Frank up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's borrowed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman reaches into his breast pocket and takes out his INTERPOL credentials. Tosses them on the table for Frank to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police... better than the alternative I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman smiles. Frank remains defiant.      He jerks his head toward the mirror confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's watching from behind there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman looks over at the mirror, taken off guard by the question. He stands and goes to the mirror -- lifts it off its hooks and sets it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing but plain wall underneath. Ackerman sits back down. Frank is a little bit chastened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a vivid imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't needed it lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in for a disappointment. I'm not Alexander Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at him blankly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come. I want to show you something Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman leads Frank through the maze of desks and police. Various members of the task force follow their progress... Jean Luc, Jones, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at a central INTEL area where Goyal sits in front of several computer monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up as Ackerman and Frank arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Goyal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up the CID Academy graduating class for 2002.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal raises an eyebrow, but does as he's told. A few moments later a photo of POLICE RECRUITS in uniform comes up on screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a good look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank peers at the screen. He spots the instructor-- Ackerman seven years younger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at the second row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT CLOSE UP on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank examines the second row. One of the young women is... CARA MASON. Her hair is pulled back. She looks more the determined police cadet than the sexy siren...  but it's definitely her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been watching you this entire time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dawning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw those men try to kill me and you didn't intervene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to apprehend a major criminal. I'm not a babysitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank grows angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to speak with somebody at the American Embassy. I'm going to tell them that you and your undercover officer knowingly and recklessly endangered the life of an American citizen! Let's see what my government has to say about that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones clears her throat from a chair across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're aware of the situation, Mr. Taylor. But we take a long view of these things... fortunately you are unhurt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll go to the press. I'll tell the entire story to the New York Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I don't think you'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I don't think you want to see Cara's entire career destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank falls silent. Ackerman puts an arm around his shoulder and leads him away from the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Espresso?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stands on a balcony overlooking a waterway. Ackerman emerges with two cups of espresso. Hands one to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Women like Cara don't come along very often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my case, they don't come along at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the worst combination: stunning looks and a brilliant mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's so smart, how did she get caught up with Pearce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started out as a straightforward placement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara (younger) poses as an art student, sketching a SCULPTURE in the Anticollegio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...we ran her deep cover to build a case against Pearce. It took. He hired her as an assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her face and smiles at an UNSEEN MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows in Cara's hair. She sits on the top deck. A MAN'S HAND passes her a drink as he walks by. She smiles at him (again we do not see his face).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she began missing drops. Omitting important details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman turns to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was no longer with us.   She was with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman finishes his espresso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She explains it now as the confusion of her new life outside the academy. That I misread her capacity for this kind of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you still using her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's all I have, Mr. Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she'll turn him in this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal walks up behind Ackerman waiting patiently for a moment to interrupt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do know however, that you are very smitten with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks back at him evenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just me, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman acknowledges the point with the barest of nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal signals that Ackerman has a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The principal apartment of a Venetian palazzo, looking out over the Grand Canal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara holds her cell phone to her ear as she walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara?     Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ACKERMAN on the phone at his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the idiot who ruined our operation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you got him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman glances out the window at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara is relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your own fault. We never should have endangered a civilian. You should have put an agent into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no time. Besides Pearce is too smart for that; he would have spotted the agent a mile away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't spot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman smiles bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently he didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara doesn't answer. Ackerman regrets the jibe.   He steps into a HALLWAY where it's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Cara. That was uncalled for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HER FACE as she listens to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on edge because of our failure today. If only the American hadn't messed everything up... I felt sure Pearce would show up today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you think he didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman's face lights up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman strides into the room, calling for attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay everybody, listen up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones, Quinn, Jean Luc and the rest of the team assemble. Goyal has Frank with him, dragging him around like a lost puppy dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a location and time for the next meet.    Pearce's villa. Eight o'clock. We have to move fast--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearce's own villa? Why would he risk going back there? He must know we'd be watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps he's nostalgic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt that. Maybe there's something of value still there. He left in a hurry after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call in a search team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We searched the place after the raid last year. If there's anything hidden there, only Pearce knows where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to get agents in place all around the villa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank speaks up unexpectedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're all around his house, will he show up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen heads turn to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I needed your advice Mr. Taylor, I'd ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shrinks down in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.   Ackerman turns back to the rest of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establish a wide perimeter. We'll keep our distance and wire the entire villa for video surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meeting breaks up.   Everybody jumps into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON QUINN as he slips out a side door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A standard hotel room-- no lavish suite this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stands in front of the mirror. Her shirt is unbuttoned as she works to attach a TINY MICROPHONE to her bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape gets stuck to itself and she has to start over..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK on her hotel room door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters the room.    Sees her half-dressed--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.   Come over here.    I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an echo of their first meeting on the train (but without the false flirtation) she turns to him and hands him a piece of tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet.   A flicker of a smile passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's fingers are perfectly steady this time as he helps her secure the microphone and do up her shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman told me everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no apology necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps back from her.    She smooths her blouse.   Turn to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the wire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the most beautiful woman on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The complete honesty and directness of his compliment takes her by surprise. She's strangely moved by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She brushes her hand affectionately over his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When will you go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman asked me to stay with the surveillance team in case the thugs who came after me at the Danieli show up. I'm the only one who can identify them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something occurs to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell him to keep an eye on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (busted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to make sure you were safe until this was over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.   A little pleased at her concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't worry about me. What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a beat, then puts her game face on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light mist. The sound of water lapping against the shore. The scene is familiar... almost identical to the night of the raid just over a year ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a wind picks up and blows the mist clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL an undercover POLICEMAN with an earpiece walking a dog a block away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A ROOFTOP three blocks away -   A SNIPER with a scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE AN APARTMENT - a FEMALE AGENT with binoculars scans the empty street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE CORNER - two blocks down is a village CHURCH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman and his team have set up a make-shift surveillance outpost here. The high-tech equipment looks incongruous with the thousand year-old stone walls and worn oak pews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bank of monitors reveals various views of the inside and outside of Alexander's villa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hovers in the background behind Ackerman. He notices Ackerman has a copy of the International Herald Tribune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all read the same newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good paper. And sold throughout the world. Makes the classified ads especially useful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods. Ackerman sits down next to Frank as if he were an old pal instead of a quasi-captive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the internet came about, hardly anybody uses old school methods like that to communicate anymore. Except Alexander Pearce. No lines to tap. No signals to intercept. (admiringly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very clever man, your double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to meeting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PATROL BOAT circles in the canal behind the villa.   On of Ackerman's ITALIAN AGENTS is at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a flat-bottomed black BOAT motoring toward him. A light from the boat shines in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Italian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to turn around, sir. There's been a chemical spill in this area--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWWWAP! A silenced bullet strikes him in the forehead. The agent topples into the water with a gentle splash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black boat steers around the rudderless patrol boat and heads toward the villa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BINOCULAR POV - a lone female figure walks down the cobblestone streets toward the villa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's approaching the destination now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black boat slips underneath some moorings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gloved hand tosses a grappling hook up to a beam ten feet overhead. It catches. The boat is tied off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silently, a masked figure begins to climb from the boat up into the bottom floor of the villa in the semi- darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEARCE'S ENTRY HALL. Cara unlocks the front door with a key and walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK from screen to screen as WE FOLLOW Cara moving through the deserted rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything is cold and lifeless.   Like a palace that has been turned into a museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While everyone is focused on the monitors showing Cara's progress, Frank notices some movement in a monitor far off to one side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shows the lower floor of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to look. A male figure, his face masked, approaches the lens of the surveillance camera...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLINK!   The FEED shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman barks at a technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Get it back on line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surveillance techs begin madly punching buttons, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that Pearce?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he know there would be a camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLINK!   Another monitor goes dark.   Then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking out the entire surveillance system--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't! He's cutting the feed at the source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks anxiously at Cara on the monitor climbing the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blink! She disappears from view as well.      Everybody starts talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can one man move through the house that fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!    Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They quiet down.   Ackerman turns to the tech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we still have audio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tech nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody in the Church stands stock still.    Staring at the dark monitors. Listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's footsteps click up the stairs and then slow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move tentatively across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR A THUMP.   A door or a heavy footstep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara's breathing gets louder.    There's somebody else in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alexander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.   Click, clack, click... She takes a few ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FRANK -- concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON ACKERMAN -- calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara stands in the center of the large room. She catches sight of her reflection in the large floor-to-ceiling window. There's a movement in the doorway behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spins around to face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEMIDOV.   He and his two men have removed their masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to disappoint you, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara pales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody strains to hear what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you this evening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a tremor in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The accent is Russ--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Ivan Demidov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertainly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara takes a step back toward the window.   Demidov follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're waiting for someone, Ms. Mason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara doesn't reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't seen Alexander Pearce in a long time, yes? I'm sure it will be a touching reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind, we'll keep you company while you wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to wait for Alexander Pearce. Just like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER'S POV - CARA has maneuvered close enough to the window that she is visible. As they approach, Demidov and his two men come into range as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his radio mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's brought them to the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody is listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...there are three of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FRANK'S FACE - he looks around at the cops desperately hoping somebody will do something. They all look to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov circles Cara dangerously close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not very polite of your boyfriend to keep you waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loses track of time easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a hard time believing that. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps he's already here somewhere... hiding... even watching us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long silence.    The tension grows.   Then we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the room flinches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I have a feeling he is around here somewhere. And if he cares about you... if he wants to see your lovely face again... he should show up before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER SLAP - MORE VICIOUS THAN THE FIRST.      This tim Cara cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal turns to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov's right. He's here somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SLAP.    Another scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean Luc looks to his colleagues-- Jones, Quinn... then turns to Ackerman. Every one of them is about to burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to do something--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harsh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my agent. She's my responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muffled THUD. Cara groans and WE HEAR her body hit the floor. That wasn't a slap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every cop in the room is clenching his weapon. Desperate for the order to move. To jump in and stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are all looking to Ackerman to give the order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the silence wears on, even Jones starts to waver. She speaks quietly to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lack of sound in the church is even more disturbing than before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Goyal notices...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Taylor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs for all he's worth.    Panting for breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank bursts through the front door.      Races to the st without hesitating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara lies on her side at Demidov's feet.     Blood trickl from the side of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes are clouded with fear and pain as she views the room half-askew. Then they suddenly come into focus as she sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A figure walks into the room.    FRANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stand motionless in the doorway, surprisingly calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans down to Cara)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news. He loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov's men take Frank by either arm and roughly drag him forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara lifts her head with an effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Alexander Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov ignores her and walks up to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Mr. Pearce, I thought I was finished with this sort of thing. But in your case, I've been forced to make an exception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out his hand and one of his THUGS gives him a PISTOL and a SILENCER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is NOT Alexander Pearce!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov begins screwing the silencer onto the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs push Frank to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's barely paying attention to them.    His eyes are locked on Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She meets his gaze. For a moment, it's as if nothing else in the world exists but the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may only be a hapless tourist, but he loves her. He's the one here, willing to give up his life to save hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Frank...   I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to be sorry for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov finishes attaching the silencer.    He points the gun at the back of Frank's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good bye Mr. Pearce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment, Cara fills her lungs and screams:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bends her head toward her cleavage, yelling into the tiny microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Ackerman!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov is taken off guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her scream echoes through the arched church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman gives the order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNIPER'S POV - Demidov and his gun-wielding henchmen standing over Frank and Cara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge, plate glass window shatters as the high powered bullet slams through it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything explodes in a mass of blood and glass. SCARFACE is blown off his feet. His body hits the ground next to Frank... his gun skitters across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov looks from the window to Cara with cold fury in his eyes-- she's the one who has called in the artillery. He raises his pistol toward her, point blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!    The gunshot takes him by surprise.   He turns to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRANK holds Scarface's smoking pistol in his hand. Demidov just has time to process the fact that Frank is the one who shot him before the life drains from his eyes and he topples...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demidov's other bodyguard fires out the windows wildly and makes a run for it. Glass flies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank throws his body over Cara to protect her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A short and furious exchange of gunfire as the other plate glass windows explode. Wood splinters fill the air as furniture is torn apart. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the sniper's bullets finds its target and the BODYGUARD goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank remains on top of Cara, shielding her until long after everything has fallen silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman and his team approach, guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undercover agents converge as well, closing the perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Cara sit in the middle of the room amongst a sea of broken glass. Just getting over the shock of being alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara nods. She looks at him for a long moment, then breaks out into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did well to choose you on the train...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's turn to smile.   He looks around the room at the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't get to arrest Alexander Pearce...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank slides closer to her. Gently, carefully, he slips his hands into Cara's cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprised, Cara starts to pull back-- but he puts a finger to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates... looks at him questioningly. But she doesn't protest as his fingers move toward her bra...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and grasp the tiny MICROPHONE. With a sharp tug, he rips it free. He tosses it across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he leans a little closer and whispers in her ear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a British accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong. I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She straightens up.   Her heart skips a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.   I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers her mouth.   Her eyes mist over with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingers over his face with loving amazement. Like a blind person trying to recognize a familiar face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mind reels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then their lips meet. They kiss. And kiss.      Like drinking from a fresh spring in the desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally she pulls away and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said I'd told so many lies, you wouldn't believe me even if I did tell the truth... This was the only way to convince you. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truth is that I love you. All that matters is that you believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares into his eyes for a beat. Finally looking at her without a trace of deception. She believes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hear voices on the stairs below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank holds up a finger to her-- wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank crawls across the room and presses a hidden latch on a built-in bookshelf. It swings out of the way to reveal a hidden safe built into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank removes the fitted floor boards. There is a sophisticated BIO-METRIC LOCK -- just like the one at the gate in the beginning of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank places his finger on the spot and the lock clicks open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK WITH ACKERMAN up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads the team into the PENTHOUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around at the mess as the agents fan out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara leans on Frank's arm as she heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara... I want the paramedics to make sure you're all right--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows right past him.     Ackerman calls out after he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cara...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses.   Turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman looks down for a moment, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... I... we'll talk about this later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we won't. There's nothing to talk about. I don't work for you anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past him.    For a moment Ackerman and Frank lo at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.   Taylor...   you're free to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Frank with a measure of begrudging respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems I underestimated you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (American accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems you did, Mr. Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Frank steps out of the room.    Ackerman's attention is distracted by--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... over here. Take a look at this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal has found the safe.   Ackerman comes over and looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT CLOSE UP - the only thing in the safe is a single FLASH DRIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal signals to one of the TECHS. He opens a laptop on the desk and they plug in the FLASH DRIVE to check the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While they are doing this, Ackerman bends to inspect the BIO-METRIC LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jones looks on eagerly as numbers fill the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Account numbers... access codes... unless I'm mistaken... he left the money behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mistake perhaps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goyal scans down to a total...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like 744 million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no mistake... (walks over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his tax bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds out her hand to the TECH who has just removed the FLASH DRIVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slips it into her pocket, then turns to Ackerman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman has moved away. He's staring down at the ground -- from behind he looks like a man defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well John... with the funds recovered, I don't think there's going to be any appetite from our side to continue this investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ackerman's shoulders are slumped, staring at Demidov's dead body on the ground. Jones puts a hand on his back, consoling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you didn't get your man.
